Git

Installation

  1. Print git version or install it: 

    # git --version || apt install git

Configuration

Configuration is located in ~/.gitconfig.

  1. Set user: 

    $ git config --global user.name <USER>
$ git config --global user.email <USER@ADDRESS.DOMAIN>

  2. Set name of default branch (default: branch): 

    $ git config --global init.defaultBranch main

  3. Allow credentials to be stored in .git-credentials: 

    $ git config --global credential.helper store

Usage

Start

  1. Start a new project:
    • From existing repository: 

      $ git clone <REPOSITORY> [DIRECTORY]

    • From new repository: 

      $ git init [-b main]

Commit Change

  1. Add all project files to the index and commit them: 

    $ git add -A
$ git commit -m '<MESSAGE>'

Change Status

  • Show current project changes compared to HEAD: 

    $ git status

  • Show commit history: 

    $ git log --all [--stat]

  • Show what changed in (default: last) commit: 

    $ git show [COMMIT]

Restore Change

  • Restore project to state of last commit (HEAD) by removing untracked and modified files: 

    $ git reset --hard && git clean -fxd

  • Detach head to specific previous commit: 

    $ git reset --hard && git clean -fxd && git checkout <COMMIT>

Branches

  • Show current branch: 

    $ git branch

  • Create branch from specific commit (default: current commit): 

    $ git branch <NEW-BRANCH>

  • Change branch: 

    $ git checkout <BRANCH>

  • Delete branch: 

    $ git branch -d <BRANCH>

Merge Change

  1. Merge changes from other branch to current branch: 

    $ git merge <BRANCH> -m '<MESSAGE>'

    • If there is a conflict:
      • Abort merge: 

        $ git merge --abort

      • Resolve merge: 

        $ nvim <FILE>
$ git commit -m '<MESSAGE>'

Collaboration

  • Push commits to git platform: 

    $ git push

  • Obtain commits from platform: 

    $ git pull

Git Platforms Tokens

Github

  1. Navigate to Github
  2. (Profile picture) ⇒ Settings ⇒ Developer settings ⇒ Personal access tokens ⇒ Generate new token
  3. Configure new personal access token:
    1. Note: access_<YYYY>-<MM>-<DD>_<DAYS>
    2. Expiry: <DAYS>
    3. Select scopes: repo, admin:enterprise and admin:gpg_key
